document.masterDocTitle: Taxonomic revision of the family Eosentomidae (Hexapoda: Protura) from Japan 2701

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Taxonomic revision of the family Eosentomidae (Hexapoda: Protura) from Japan 2701

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type specimens. Holotype female ( NSMT –Ap 521), Koguchi, Bato–machi, Tochigi Prefecture , 36°45'57"N , 140°08'52"E , 150 m elevation, litter of a plantation of
Cr. japonica
, 28-X-2002 , Y. Hagiwara leg. Paratypes : 2 males ( NSMT –Ap 522–523), 2 female ( NSMT –Ap 524), same data as for the holotype ; 2 female ( NSMT –Ap 525), Ryugu, Oze, Katashina–mura, Gunma Prefecture , 1450 m elevation, 36°55'41"N , 139°14' 20"E , litter of a forest dominated by
F. crenata
and
Q. crispula
, 23-X-1994 , Sakayori et al. leg.

Other specimens examined. Three males, 4 females , 1 larva II, Mt. Hanagame–yama, Daigo–machi, Ibaraki Prefecture , 36°52'57"N , 140°15'21"E , 670 m elevation, litter of a forest dominated by
Abies firma
,
F. japonica
and
Q. crispula
, 21-VI-2003 , H. Hosoda & Y. Hagiwara leg.; one female , Mt. Nandai–san, Iwama–machi, Ibaraki Prefecture , 36º18'16"N , 140º13'20"E , 460 m elevation, litter of a forest dominated by and
Carpinus laxiflora
and
Q. serrata
, 20-VI-1998 , H. Sakayori et al. leg.; 1 female , 3 larvae II, same data as for the holotype ; 1 larva II, same locality,
8- VII- 2002
, K. Furuno et al. leg.; 1 female , 1 larva II, Mt. Shirane–san, Sotoyama, Yumoto, Nikko–shi, Tochigi Prefecture , 36°47'53"N , 139°24'20"E , 2130m elevation, litter of a forest dominated by
T. diversifolia
and
R. bracycarpum ,
14-IX-1997 , Furuno et al. leg.; 1 female , Mt. Nantai–san, Nikko–shi, Tochigi Prefecture , 36°45'55"N , 139°29'27"E , 2480 m elevation, litter of a forest dominated by
A. veitchii ,
14-X-1983 , K. Ishii leg.; 1 female , Yumoto, Nasu–machi, Tochigi Prefecture , 37°05'54"N , 140°00'16"E , 1000 m elevation, litter of a deciduous broad-leaved forest,
31- VII- 1985
, O. Nakamura et al. leg.

caption.paragraph:
FIGURE 50.
Eosentomon spatulatum
sp. nov.
A, dorsal view of head, right side; B, sensilla posterior to pseudoculus; C, labrum and rostral region, dorsal view; D, labrum and rostral region, lateral view; E, maxillary palpus; F, galea; G, mandible; H, pseudoculus; I, exterior view of foretarsus; J, interior view of foretarsus; K, dorsal view of hind tarsus; L, tracheal camerae on thoracic tergite III; M, central lobe on abdominal tergite II; N, laterostigmata II–IV. B, D, E, G, H, K, L, N, holotype, female; A, C, F, M, paratype, female; I, J, paratype, male. Scales: 20 µm.

FIGURE 51.
Eosentomon spatulatum
sp. nov.
A, female squama genitalis; B, female squama genitalis of another specimen; C, male squama genitalis; D, abdominal tergites VI–VII; E, posterior margin of abdominal tergite VIII; F, abdominal tergites II–IV of larva II. A, D, holotype, female; C, paratype, male; B, F, female and larva II from Mt. Hanagameyama, Ibaraki Prefecture, respectively. Scales: 20 µm.

TABLE 22. Chaetotaxy of
Eosentomon spatulatum
sp. nov.

subSubSection.paragraph: Description. Body length 630 (533–773) µm. Head 96 (99–104) µm long, 73 (73–76) µm wide. Setae pa and m4 present, but seta aa absent ( Fig. 50A ), sensilla as and ps present; seta sp 1.5 (1.6–1.8) times longer than p ; sensilla pp distinct ( Fig. 50B ). Labral setae present ( Figs. 50C, D ). Seta rs inflated, shorter than sr ( Figs. 50C, D ). On maxillary palpus ( Fig. 50E ) sensillum md , 8 (7–8) µm long, longer than ml of 5 (5) µm. Digits on galea developed, O longer than M and I ( Fig. 50F ). Mandible with three teeth ( Fig. 50G ). Clypeal apodemes distinct ( Figs. 50A, C ). Pseudoculus almost circular with no inner structure ( Fig. 50H ), 9–11 µm long, PR = 9–11.

Foretarsus length ( Figs. 50I, J ) 70 (70–73) µm; claw 15 (15–16) µm, TR = 5.0 (4.8–5.0); empodium 15 (13–15) µm, EU = 1.0 (0.9–1.0); sensillum s as long as or slightly longer than claw, 15 (15–19) µm. Sensillum t1 nearer to α 3 than to α 3' , BS = 0.9 (0.8–0.9); t2 slightly spatulate; t3 surpassing base of α 7 ; a not reaching base of γ 2 ; b surpassing base of β 5 ; c almost reaching base of γ 3 ; d surpassing base of α 5 ; e and g spatulate and long; f1 thinly spatulate; f2 almost reaching base of γ 5 ; a' reaching level of α 3’ and at same level with α 3 ; b'1 absent; b'2 slightly spatulate; c' not surpassing tarsus. Length of middle tarsus 36 (34–36) µm, length of claw 11 (11) µm; hind tarsus 43 (41–44) µm, claw 13 (11–13) µm; empodia of both tarsi short, about 1/10 of claw length ( Fig. 50K ); on hind tarsus ( Fig. 50K ) D2 and D4 similar, spine-like.

Chaetotaxy as in Table 22 . On thoracic tergites II and III, P1a and P2a seta-like and shorter than P1 ; P1a posterior to P1–P2 and halfway between P1 and P2 ; P2a at same level with P2–P3 . P1a on abdominal tergite I, P1a and P2a on II–VI and P2a on VII filiform and longer than P1 , at posterior margin ( Fig. 51D ); P1a on VII sensillum-like, shorter than one-third length of P1 , at hind margin ( Fig. 51D ); on tergite VIII ( Fig. 51E ) P1a' short with basal dilatation and anterior to P2 ; P2a linear.

Larva II. Body length 494–735 µm. Head 82–98 µm long, 64–74 µm wide; pseudoculus 8 µm long, PR = 10– 13. Foretarsus length 55–66 µm; claw 13–15 µm, TR = 4.3–4.8; empodium 14 µm, EU = 1.0; sensillum s 16–17 µm; BS = 0.7–0.9. Length of middle tarsus 27–33 µm, length of claw 9–11 µm; hind tarsus 33–39 µm, claw 10–12 µm. P5 on abdominal tergites II and III displaced anteriorly and at level of A4 on III ( Fig. 51F ).

Chaetotaxic variations observed consisted of doubled P1 of right side on the abdominal sternite III of one female from Bato–machi, the presence of A3 on the abdominal tergite IV of two females from Bato–machi, and the asymmetric absence of A3 on the abdominal sternite III of one female from Mt. Hanagame –yama
.
Etymology. The specific name is derived from the characteristic small "spatulate" sensilla t2 and b'2 on foretarsus.
